title.narrative: Emergency Safe Shelter for Most Recent IDPs in Salqin, NW Syria

description.narrative: This project aims at responding to the critical and the basic needs of 170 of newly displaced families, with 1020 total of individuals disaggregated approximately ( 147 men, 180 women, 332 boys, 361 girls) through the expansion of Tlul informal IDP camp located in (Idleb, Harim, Salqin, Tlul community). The project will be implemented in partnership with Muzun for Humanitarian amp Development (MHD) organization. SDI will provide the shelterampNFI kits response including preparing the site in terms of graveling, demarcation, providing associated infrastructure, fencing, installing the tents, rain drainage system, providing solar lighting poles and providing NFI kits, while MHD will provide CCCM and WASH services including construction of latrines, providing water tanks with solar system, and support the camp with water, solid waste removal, and sanitation on daily basis. Three committees will be formed including IDP site representative committee and 2 sub-committees of 1- Infrastructure and 2- Fire Safety and Security. Committees will include female and disabled members to ensure more inclusive approach. CM building and warehouse and office utilities will be provided in addition to training for all committees in addition to the existing Camps Management will receive capacity building and support including reporting tools and respond during emergencies according to their ToRs. The land of the Tlul camp with the proposed extension is of 22,100 sqm space. It is properly absorbent for rainwater, and the land slope is 2.66% on an elevation between 298 and 290 with a length of 300 meters and a width of 72-85 meters. The HLP due diligence with all necessary agreements and ownership confirmation documents were obtained to extend the camp. The local authority and community representative were also engaged and they were willing to extend the camp and provide shelter for the displaced families. An agreement with the local council will be signed. People with disabilities and people with specific needs are considered by providing accessible facilities and 4 wheelchairs and by providing one PWD-friendly latrine in each latrine block. All activities were designed and will be implemented in accordance with relevant clusters guidelines and minimum sphere standards, including the living space, water, latrines available for per person, the distance between tents, fire breaks, specifications of items provided, design of the site and building, protection and security...etc. The staff of the project will have awareness sessions on GBV and PSEA to ensure that all of them are aware of dealing with these cases and able to refer them to Global community (GC) focal point. Community Mobilization team will provide hygiene awareness sessions for general hygiene and complete information about the camp services and registering the arriving IDPs and guiding them through the awareness team (Most of them will be women). Female field staff will be hired to increase the protection of women and girls, and 4 accountability boxes, as well as the complaint number, will be available for all the camp residents. The construction works will be implemented through a contractor, and the tenders will be done in accordance with SDI's procurement policies and procedures. As to ensure multi-sectoral services for the targeted beneficiaries, SDI and MHD will manage to secure multi-sectorial services access for IDPs through active coordination with other clusters and through the contribution from SDI and MHD ongoing projects over project implementation period considering minimum sphere standards. SDI and MHD will keep monitoring the damage and provide maintenance works during the project period. SDI MEAL team will be responsible for the MampE activities, including DM, PDM and beneficiary satisfaction of all activities including those implemented by SDI and by MHD.
